intro: Anagyris glauca, commonly known as the blue flax or blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Anagyris glauca is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it a notable species for both ecological and ornamental purposes.
